Free Advice and Support (SENDIASS)

  • Contact us
  • My Gloucester
  • News
  • Subscribe
  1. Home
  2. SEND
  3. Free Advice and Support (SENDIASS)

SENDIASS stands for SEND Information, Advice and Support Service. It is a free service that helps families understand their options and rights when it comes to SEND.

What you need to know

  • ✓ Free — you will never be charged
  • ✓ Impartial — they do not work for the council, school or NHS
  • ✓ Confidential — what you discuss stays between you
  • ✓ For families — parents, carers and young people can all use the service

Who SENDIASS helps

  • Parents and carers of children and young people with SEND
  • Children and young people with SEND (in age-appropriate ways)
  • Young people aged 16 to 25 with SEND, in their own right

What SENDIASS can help you with

Understanding the EHC process

Help with requesting assessments, understanding your child's EHC plan, and preparing for annual reviews.

Knowing your rights

Clear information about what the law says and what the council, school and NHS must do.

Resolving disagreements

Advice on what to do if you disagree with a decision, including mediation and the SEND Tribunal.

School support

Understanding what support your child should be getting in school and what to do if it is not working.

Preparing for adulthood

Support with transition planning, moving to college, and understanding adult social care.

General SEND questions

Any question about SEND, no matter how small. There is no such thing as a silly question.

Good to know

SENDIASS provides information and advice — they help you understand your options so you can make informed decisions. They are not advocates (they do not speak for you at meetings), but they can help you prepare and feel confident.

The council is legally required to provide this service under Section 32 of the Children and Families Act 2014.

Get in touch with SENDIASS

You do not need a referral. You can contact SENDIASS directly, at any time.

  • Phone: 01452 328000
  • Email: sendiass@gloucestershire.gov.uk

Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm (term time). Reduced hours during school holidays.

Free and impartial

SENDIASS is independent of the council's decision-making. Their only goal is to help you.

Contact SENDIASS

Phone

01452 328000
Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm

Email

sendiass@gloucestershire.gov.uk
